sentences.sContent: The US must now take a firm leadership role.
sentences.sCn: 美国现在必须扮演一个强有力的领导人角色。

sentences.sContent: The next leadership election is due in November.
sentences.sCn: 下一届领导人选举将在十一月举行。

sentences.sContent: ...This difference in handling conflict could be the deciding factor on who gets promoted to a leadership position and who does not...
...Americans have taken for granted the United States' leadership position in the development of new technologies...
...They believe that constant motion somehow generates leadership as a byproduct...
...Many business executives confuse leadership with action...
...Their one leadership tool is volume: if they think you aren't working as hard as they think you should...
...I see way fewer truly effective leaders than I see people stuck in positions of leadership who are sadly incompetent and seriously misguided about their own abilities...

phrases.pCn: 领导技巧；领导技能；领导艺术
总成本领先；全面成本领先；成本优先

remMethod.val: leader(领导者) ＋ ship(表身份) → 领导

words.tran: 促使（lead的过去分词）；引导；带领

trans.tranOther: the position of being the leader of a group, organization, country etc
